response: narrative=Aaron Moran, last seen leaving a tutoring center after experiencing job loss stress at home, was found in the wilderness near Beltie Road, his passport and documents left behind.

narrative=Aaron Moran, a young boy under foster care, went missing from his home on Craigour Road, Torphins. His foster mother reported him missing after noticing his usual playful demeanor had turned unusually reserved. Prior to his disappearance, he mentioned a sense of curiosity about visiting his friend who recently moved to Seafield Circle, Buckie. Authorities initially focused on nearby familiar locations, including the area around Beltie Road, which Aaron frequently visited with his foster mother. After a coordinated search, Aaron was located by police on North Road, Insch. Thankfully, he was safe and unharmed, having wandered off on an unplanned adventure.

narrative=Aaron Moran, aged 9, was last seen at a cafe in an urban area with his foster mother before he wandered off toward the nearby wilderness. Authorities joined Louis Burgess in the search to locate him safely.

narrative=Aaron Moran, a 10-year-old boy, was reported missing from his foster home on Craigour Road, Torphins. It was discovered that Aaron left without taking his passport and necessary documents, hinting at no plan for an extended absence. Initial reports indicated he might have been at a nearby cafe before disappearing. Authorities focused search efforts around familiar and nearby addresses, including 10 Garden Wood, Inchmarlo, and Gordon Crescent. Eventually, through diligent efforts by tracing staff, Aaron was located safely at 10 East Cathcart Street, AB56 1PJ. There was no immediate indication of foul play, and Aaron appeared to be unharmed. The circumstances of his temporary disappearance remain under review.
